intro: Carex minuticulmis, commonly known as the minute sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or wet meadows. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its compact size and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Carex minuticulmis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
